abstract: Report claims Egypt's campaign against Islamists in North Sinai has demolished more homes and displaced more citizens than originally planned; insurgency, which Egypt claims collaborates with Gaza Strip militants via tunnel, shows no signs of weakening, and experts warn government tactics, which alienate locals, could cause them to support rebels
lead_paragraph: In clearing a buffer zone to crack down on Islamic insurgents, Egypt has destroyed 3,255 homes — four times the number it said would be, according to Human Rights Watch.

headline.main: Egypt Destroying Far More Homes Than Buffer-Zone Plan Called For, Report Says
headline.print_headline: Egypt Destroying Far More Homes Than Buffer-Zone Plan Called For, Report Says

snippet: In clearing a buffer zone to crack down on Islamic insurgents, Egypt has destroyed 3,255 homes — four times the number it said would be, according to Human Rights Watch.
